BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: BIL HOUSING DEVELOPMENT FUND CO INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO OPERATE A HOUSING PROJECT FOR ELDERLY AND HANDICAPPED PERSONS OF LOW INCOME, WHERE NO ADEQUATE HOUSING EXISTS, AND TO PROMOTE THE WELFARE OF THE PEOPLE RESIDING IN THE PROJECT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO OPERATE A HOUSING PROJECT FOR ELDERLY AND HANDICAPPED PERSONS OF LOW INCOME, WHERE NO ADEQUATE HOUSING EXISTS, AND TO PROMOTE THE WELFARE OF THE PEOPLE RESIDING IN THE PROJECT.
IRS990.Desc: OPERATED AN 11 UNIT HOUSING PROJECT FOR AGED AND HANDICAPPED PERSONS OF LOW INCOME IN BUFFALO, NEW YORK.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TENANT SECURITY DEPOSITS ARE HELD IN A SEPARATE BANK ACCOUNT IN THE NAME OF THE COMPANY. INTEREST EARNED ON SUCH DEPOSITS IS PAID TO THE INDIVIDUAL TENANTS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

THE COMPANY IS EXEMPT FROM TAXATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE U.S. INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND SECTION 402 OF THE NEW YORK STATE NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION LAW AND, ACCORDINGLY, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES HAS BEEN REFLECTED IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. US GAAP PROVIDES GUIDANCE ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT FOR INCOME TAX POSITIONS THAT THE COMPANY HAS TAKEN OR EXPECTS TO TAKE IN THE COMPANY'S INCOME TAX RETURNS. ORGANIZATIONS TAKE MANY TAX POSITIONS RELATIVE TO TAX LAWS, INCLUDING THOSE TAKEN IN DETERMINING WHETHER TAX IS DUE, A REFUND IS OWED, A TAX RETURN NEEDS TO BE FILED, OR THE CHARACTERIZATION OF INCOME AS TAXABLE (FOR EXAMPLE, UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME) OR NONTAXABLE. THE COMPANY HAS NOT RECORDED ANY LIABILITIES RELATING TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE COMPANY FILES ITS RETURN OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX IN THE U.S. FEDERAL JURISDICTION AND IT'S ANNUAL FILING OF CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS IN NEW YORK STATE.

ALL EMPLOYEES ARE PAID BY BELMONT HOUSING RESOURCES FOR WNY, INC., A RELATED ENTITY. BELMONT'S COMPENSATION PROGRAM IS DEVELOPED BY SENIOR MANAGEMENT, THE HUMAN RESOURCES MANAGER, AND AN EMPLOYEE BENEFITS AND COMPENSATION CONSULTING FIRM, AND REVIEWED BY THE HR AND COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THIS COMPENSATION PROGRAM APPLIES TO ALL STAFF, INCLUDING OFFICERS. IN ADDITION, ALL COMPENSATION OF OFFICERS IS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE COMPENSATION PROGRAM INCLUDED MARKET PRICING AND JOB SLOTTING WITHIN ESTABLISHED SALARY GRADES AND RANGES BASED ON INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE INDEPENDENT CONSULTING FIRM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE ARE NO COMMITTEES WITH AUTHORITY TO ACT ON BEHALF OF THE GOVERNING BODY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN OUTSIDE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. IT IS REVIEWED BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER OF THE ORGANIZATION BEFORE IT IS FILED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE. A COPY IS PROVIDED TO THE ENTIRE BOARD AT A LATER DATE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FILING ORGANIZATION IS CURRENTLY REVIEWING THE FUTURE IMPLEMENTATION OF CONFLICT OF INTEREST, WHISTLEBLOWER AND DOCUMENT RETENTION POLICIES. HOWEVER, THE FILING ORGANIZATION HAS NO EMPLOYEES. ALL DAY TO DAY OPERATIONS ARE PERFORMED BY THE STAFF OF A RELATED ENTITY, BELMONT HOUSING RESOURCES FOR WNY, INC. BELMONT HAS IMPLEMENTED ALL THREE POLICIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL EMPLOYEES ARE PAID BY BELMONT HOUSING RESOURCES FOR WNY, INC., A RELATED ENTITY. BELMONT'S COMPENSATION PROGRAM IS DEVELOPED BY SENIOR MANAGEMENT, THE HUMAN RESOURCES MANAGER, AND AN EMPLOYEE BENEFITS AND COMPENSATION CONSULTING FIRM, AND REVIEWED BY THE HR AND COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THIS COMPENSATION PROGRAM APPLIES TO ALL STAFF, INCLUDING OFFICERS. IN ADDITION, ALL COMPENSATION OF OFFICERS IS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE COMPENSATION PROGRAM INCLUDED MARKET PRICING AND JOB SLOTTING WITHIN ESTABLISHED SALARY GRADES AND RANGES BASED ON INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE INDEPENDENT CONSULTING FIRM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FORM 1023 AND FORM 990 AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. IN ADDITION, THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990 IS ALSO AVAILABLE ON THE WEBSITE GUIDESTAR.ORG.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MAKE IT'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, INTERNAL POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
THE AUDIT OVERSIGHT PROCESS AND THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT SELECTION PROCESS HAVE NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
